message.content:
Explore all features of the Roo-Code VS Code extension. Focus on:

1. Read src/package.json - look at all commands, menus, keybindings, settings
2. Look at src/activate.ts or similar for registered commands
3. Explore the tools in src/core/prompts/tools/ - what can the AI agent do?
4. Check src/services/ for all service capabilities
5. Look at any browser automation, terminal integration, code indexing features
6. Check for marketplace/plugin system
7. Look for cloud sync, automation workflows, multi-agent features

Create a comprehensive list of ALL features this extension provides to users.

content.text: I'll systematically explore the Roo-Code VS Code extension to document all its features. Let me start by examining the structure and key configuration files.

input.description: Find key configuration and TypeScript files

1{
     2	"name": "multi-agent",
     3	"displayName": "%extension.displayName%",
     4	"description": "%extension.description%",
     5	"publisher": "imorgado",
     6	"version": "0.1.0",
     7	"icon": "assets/icons/icon.png",
     8	"galleryBanner": {
     9		"color": "#617A91",
    10		"theme": "dark"
    11	},
    12	"engines": {
    13		"vscode": "^1.84.0",
    14		"node": "20.19.2"
    15	},
    16	"author": {
    17		"name": "MultiAgent"
    18	},
    19	"repository": {
    20		"type": "git",
    21		"url": "https://github.com/imorgado/multi-agent"
    22	},
    23	"homepage": "https://github.com/imorgado/multi-agent",
    24	"categories": [
    25		"AI",
    26		"Chat",
    27		"Programming Languages",
    28		"Education",
    29		"Snippets",
    30		"Testing"
    31	],
    32	"keywords": [
    33		"multi-agent",
    34		"multiagent",
    35		"parallel",
    36		"claude",
    37		"gemini",
    38		"mcp",
    39		"openrouter",
    40		"coding",
    41		"agent",
    42		"autonomous",
    43		"ai"
    44	],
    45	"activationEvents": [
    46		"onLanguage",
    47		"onStartupFinished"
    48	],
    49	"main": "./dist/extension.js",
    50	"contributes": {
    51		"viewsContainers": {
    52			"activitybar": [
    53				{
    54					"id": "multi-agent-ActivityBar",
    55					"title": "%views.activitybar.title%",
    56					"icon": "assets/icons/icon.svg"
    57				}
    58			]
    59		},
    60		"views": {
    61			"multi-agent-ActivityBar": [
    62				{
    63					"type": "webview",
    64					"id": "multi-agent.SidebarProvider",
    65					"name": "%views.sidebar.name%"
    66				}
    67			]
    68		},
    69		"commands": [
    70			{
    71				"command": "multi-agent.plusButtonClicked",
    72				"title": "%command.newTask.title%",
    73				"icon": "$(edit)"
    74			},
    75			{
    76				"command": "multi-agent.historyButtonClicked",
    77				"title": "%command.history.title%",
    78				"icon": "$(history)"
    79			},
    80			{
    81				"command": "multi-agent.marketplaceButtonClicked",
    82				"title": "%command.marketplace.title%",
    83				"icon": "$(extensions)"
    84			},
    85			{
    86				"command": "multi-agent.popoutButtonClicked",
    87				"title": "%command.openInEditor.title%",
    88				"icon": "$(link-external)"
    89			},
    90			{
    91				"command": "multi-agent.cloudButtonClicked",
    92				"title": "%command.cloud.title%",
    93				"icon": "$(cloud)"
    94			},
    95			{
    96				"command": "multi-agent.settingsButtonClicked",
    97				"title": "%command.settings.title%",
    98				"icon": "$(settings-gear)"
    99			},
   100			{
   101				"command": "multi-agent.openInNewTab",
   102				"title": "%command.openInNewTab.title%",
   103				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   104			},
   105			{
   106				"command": "multi-agent.explainCode",
   107				"title": "%command.explainCode.title%",
   108				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   109			},
   110			{
   111				"command": "multi-agent.fixCode",
   112				"title": "%command.fixCode.title%",
   113				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   114			},
   115			{
   116				"command": "multi-agent.improveCode",
   117				"title": "%command.improveCode.title%",
   118				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   119			},
   120			{
   121				"command": "multi-agent.addToContext",
   122				"title": "%command.addToContext.title%",
   123				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   124			},
   125			{
   126				"command": "multi-agent.newTask",
   127				"title": "%command.newTask.title%",
   128				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   129			},
   130			{
   131				"command": "multi-agent.terminalAddToContext",
   132				"title": "%command.terminal.addToContext.title%",
   133				"category": "Terminal"
   134			},
   135			{
   136				"command": "multi-agent.terminalFixCommand",
   137				"title": "%command.terminal.fixCommand.title%",
   138				"category": "Terminal"
   139			},
   140			{
   141				"command": "multi-agent.terminalExplainCommand",
   142				"title": "%command.terminal.explainCommand.title%",
   143				"category": "Terminal"
   144			},
   145			{
   146				"command": "multi-agent.setCustomStoragePath",
   147				"title": "%command.setCustomStoragePath.title%",
   148				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   149			},
   150			{
   151				"command": "multi-agent.importSettings",
   152				"title": "%command.importSettings.title%",
   153				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   154			},
   155			{
   156				"command": "multi-agent.focusInput",
   157				"title": "%command.focusInput.title%",
   158				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   159			},
   160			{
   161				"command": "multi-agent.acceptInput",
   162				"title": "%command.acceptInput.title%",
   163				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   164			},
   165			{
   166				"command": "multi-agent.toggleAutoApprove",
   167				"title": "%command.toggleAutoApprove.title%",
   168				"category": "%configuration.title%"
   169			}
   170		],
   171		"menus": {
   172			"editor/context": [
   173				{
   174					"submenu": "multi-agent.contextMenu",
   175					"group": "1"
   176				}
   177			],
   178			"multi-agent.contextMenu": [
   179				{
   180					"command": "multi-agent.addToContext",
   181					"group": "1_actions@1"
   182				},
   183				{
   184					"command": "multi-agent.explainCode",
   185					"group": "1_actions@2"
   186				},
   187				{
   188					"command": "multi-agent.improveCode",
   189					"group": "1_actions@3"
   190				}
   191			],
   192			"terminal/context": [
   193				{
   194					"submenu": "multi-agent.terminalMenu",
   195					"group": "2"
   196				}
   197			],
   198			"multi-agent.terminalMenu": [
   199				{
   200					"command": "multi-agent.terminalAddToContext",
   201					"group": "1_actions@1"
   202				},
   203				{
   204					"command": "multi-agent.terminalFixCommand",
   205					"group": "1_actions@2"
   206				},
   207				{
   208					"command": "multi-agent.terminalExplainCommand",
   209					"group": "1_actions@3"
   210				}
   211			],
   212			"view/title": [
   213				{
   214					"command": "multi-agent.plusButtonClicked",
   215					"group": "navigation@1",
   216					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   217				},
   218				{
   219					"command": "multi-agent.settingsButtonClicked",
   220					"group": "navigation@2",
   221					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   222				},
   223				{
   224					"command": "multi-agent.cloudButtonClicked",
   225					"group": "navigation@3",
   226					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   227				},
   228				{
   229					"command": "multi-agent.marketplaceButtonClicked",
   230					"group": "navigation@4",
   231					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   232				},
   233				{
   234					"command": "multi-agent.historyButtonClicked",
   235					"group": "overflow@1",
   236					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   237				},
   238				{
   239					"command": "multi-agent.popoutButtonClicked",
   240					"group": "overflow@2",
   241					"when": "view == multi-agent.SidebarProvider"
   242				}
   243			],
   244			"editor/title": [
   245				{
   246					"command": "multi-agent.plusButtonClicked",
   247					"group": "navigation@1",
   248					"when": "activeWebviewPanelId == multi-agent.TabPanelProvider"
   249				},
   250				{
   251					"command": "multi-agent.settingsButtonClicked",
   252					"group": "navigation@2",
   253					"when": "activeWebviewPanelId == multi-agent.TabPanelProvider"
   254				},
   255				{
   256					"command": "multi-agent.cloudButtonClicked",
   257					"group": "navigation@3",
   258					"when": "activeWebviewPanelId == multi-agent.TabPanelProvider"
   259				},
   260				{
   261					"command": "multi-agent.marketplaceButtonClicked",
   262					"group": "navigation@4",
   263					"when": "activeWebviewPanelId == multi-agent.TabPanelProvider"
   264				},

1import * as vscode from "vscode"
     2import * as dotenvx from "@dotenvx/dotenvx"
     3import * as path from "path"
     4
     5// Load environment variables from .env file
     6try {
     7	// Specify path to .env file in the project root directory
     8	const envPath = path.join(__dirname, "..", ".env")
     9	dotenvx.config({ path: envPath })
    10} catch (e) {
    11	// Silently handle environment loading errors
    12	console.warn("Failed to load environment variables:", e)
    13}
    14
    15import type { CloudUserInfo, AuthState } from "@multi-agent/types"
    16import { CloudService, BridgeOrchestrator } from "@multi-agent/cloud"
    17import { TelemetryService, PostHogTelemetryClient } from "@multi-agent/telemetry"
    18import { customToolRegistry } from "@multi-agent/core"
    19
    20import "./utils/path" // Necessary to have access to String.prototype.toPosix.
    21import { createOutputChannelLogger, createDualLogger } from "./utils/outputChannelLogger"
    22
    23import { Package } from "./shared/package"
    24import { formatLanguage } from "./shared/language"
    25import { ContextProxy } from "./core/config/ContextProxy"
    26import { ClineProvider } from "./core/webview/ClineProvider"
    27import { DIFF_VIEW_URI_SCHEME } from "./integrations/editor/DiffViewProvider"
    28import { TerminalRegistry } from "./integrations/terminal/TerminalRegistry"
    29import { claudeCodeOAuthManager } from "./integrations/claude-code/oauth"
    30import { googleOAuthManager } from "./integrations/google"
    31import { McpServerManager } from "./services/mcp/McpServerManager"
    32import { BundledMcpManager } from "./services/mcp/bundled"
    33import { CodeIndexManager } from "./services/code-index/manager"
    34import { WorkspaceManager } from "./services/workspace"
    35import { AutomationManager } from "./services/automation/AutomationManager"
    36import { BrowserPreviewManager } from "./services/browser"
    37import { BrowserExtensionBridge } from "./services/browser-bridge"
    38import { MdmService } from "./services/mdm/MdmService"
    39import { migrateSettings } from "./utils/migrateSettings"
    40import { autoImportSettings } from "./utils/autoImportSettings"
    41import { API } from "./extension/api"
    42
    43import {
    44	handleUri,
    45	registerCommands,
    46	registerCodeActions,
    47	registerTerminalActions,
    48	CodeActionProvider,
    49} from "./activate"
    50import { initializeI18n } from "./i18n"
    51import { flushModels, initializeModelCacheRefresh, refreshModels } from "./api/providers/fetchers/modelCache"
    52
    53/**
    54 * Built using https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-webview-ui-toolkit
    55 *
    56 * Inspired by:
    57 *  - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-webview-ui-toolkit-samples/tree/main/default/weather-webview
    58 *  - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-webview-ui-toolkit-samples/tree/main/frameworks/hello-world-react-cra
    59 */
    60
    61let outputChannel: vscode.OutputChannel
    62let extensionContext: vscode.ExtensionContext
    63let cloudService: CloudService | undefined
    64let automationManager: AutomationManager | undefined
    65
    66let authStateChangedHandler: ((data: { state: AuthState; previousState: AuthState }) => Promise<void>) | undefined
    67let settingsUpdatedHandler: (() => void) | undefined
    68let userInfoHandler: ((data: { userInfo: CloudUserInfo }) => Promise<void>) | undefined
    69
    70// This method is called when your extension is activated.
    71// Your extension is activated the very first time the command is executed.
    72export async function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
    73	extensionContext = context
    74	outputChannel = vscode.window.createOutputChannel(Package.outputChannel)
    75	context.subscriptions.push(outputChannel)
    76	outputChannel.appendLine(`${Package.name} extension activated - ${JSON.stringify(Package)}`)
    77
    78	// Set extension path for custom tool registry to find bundled esbuild
    79	customToolRegistry.setExtensionPath(context.extensionPath)
    80
    81	// Migrate old settings to new
    82	await migrateSettings(context, outputChannel)
    83
    84	// Initialize telemetry service.
    85	const telemetryService = TelemetryService.createInstance()
    86
    87	try {
    88		telemetryService.register(new PostHogTelemetryClient())
    89	} catch (error) {
    90		console.warn("Failed to register PostHogTelemetryClient:", error)
    91	}
    92
    93	// Create logger for cloud services.
    94	const cloudLogger = createDualLogger(createOutputChannelLogger(outputChannel))
    95
    96	// Initialize MDM service
    97	const mdmService = await MdmService.createInstance(cloudLogger)
    98
    99	// Initialize i18n for internationalization support.
   100	initializeI18n(context.globalState.get("language") ?? formatLanguage(vscode.env.language))
   101
   102	// Initialize terminal shell execution handlers.
   103	TerminalRegistry.initialize()
   104
   105	// Initialize Claude Code OAuth manager for direct API access.
   106	claudeCodeOAuthManager.initialize(context)
   107
   108	// Initialize Google OAuth manager for Gemini subscription features.
   109	googleOAuthManager.initialize(context)
   110
   111	// Get default commands from configuration.
   112	const defaultCommands = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration(Package.name).get<string[]>("allowedCommands") || []
   113
   114	// Initialize global state if not already set.
   115	if (!context.globalState.get("allowedCommands")) {
   116		context.globalState.update("allowedCommands", defaultCommands)
   117	}
   118
   119	const contextProxy = await ContextProxy.getInstance(context)
   120
   121	// Initialize code index managers for all workspace folders.
   122	const codeIndexManagers: CodeIndexManager[] = []
   123
   124	if (vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders) {
   125		for (const folder of vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders) {
   126			const manager = CodeIndexManager.getInstance(context, folder.uri.fsPath)
   127
   128			if (manager) {
   129				codeIndexManagers.push(manager)
   130
   131				// Initialize in background; do not block extension activation
   132				void manager.initialize(contextProxy).catch((error) => {
   133					const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
   134					outputChannel.appendLine(
   135						`[CodeIndexManager] Error during background CodeIndexManager configuration/indexing for ${folder.uri.fsPath}: ${message}`,
   136					)
   137				})
   138
   139				context.subscriptions.push(manager)
   140			}
   141		}
   142	}
   143
   144	// Initialize bundled MCP servers manager (Docker, GitHub, Railway, Stripe)
   145	// This must be initialized before ClineProvider so McpHub can access it
   146	BundledMcpManager.getInstance(context)
   147
   148	// Initialize browser preview manager for SimpleBrowser/Puppeteer integration
   149	BrowserPreviewManager.getInstance(context)
   150

</system-reminder>

300
   301	// Add to subscriptions for proper cleanup on deactivate.
   302	context.subscriptions.push(cloudService)
   303
   304	// Trigger initial cloud profile sync now that CloudService is ready.
   305	try {
   306		await provider.initializeCloudProfileSyncWhenReady()
   307	} catch (error) {
   308		outputChannel.appendLine(
   309			`[CloudService] Failed to initialize cloud profile sync: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
   310		)
   311	}
   312
   313	// Finish initializing the provider.
   314	TelemetryService.instance.setProvider(provider)
   315
   316	context.subscriptions.push(
   317		vscode.window.registerWebviewViewProvider(ClineProvider.sideBarId, provider, {
   318			webviewOptions: { retainContextWhenHidden: true },
   319		}),
   320	)
   321
   322	// Initialize automation manager for workflow automations
   323	const automationsEnabled = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration(Package.name).get<boolean>("automations.enabled", true)
   324	const firstWorkspacePath = vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders?.[0]?.uri.fsPath
   325
   326	if (firstWorkspacePath) {
   327		automationManager = new AutomationManager({
   328			workspacePath: firstWorkspacePath,
   329			taskProvider: provider,
   330			enabled: automationsEnabled,
   331		})
   332
   333		// Initialize in background
   334		automationManager.initialize().catch((error) => {
   335			outputChannel.appendLine(
   336				`[AutomationManager] Error during initialization: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
   337			)
   338		})
   339
   340		// Listen for automation events
   341		automationManager.onAutomationTriggered(({ automation, payload }) => {
   342			outputChannel.appendLine(`[AutomationManager] Automation triggered: ${automation.name} (${automation.id})`)
   343		})
   344
   345		automationManager.onAutomationExecuted((result) => {
   346			outputChannel.appendLine(
   347				`[AutomationManager] Automation executed: ${result.automationId} - ${result.success ? "success" : "failed"}${result.error ? `: ${result.error}` : ""}`,
   348			)
   349		})
   350
   351		// Listen for configuration changes
   352		context.subscriptions.push(
   353			vscode.workspace.onDidChangeConfiguration((e) => {
   354				if (e.affectsConfiguration(`${Package.name}.automations.enabled`) && automationManager) {
   355					const enabled = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration(Package.name).get<boolean>("automations.enabled", true)
   356					automationManager.setEnabled(enabled)
   357				}
   358			}),
   359		)
   360
   361		// Add to disposables
   362		context.subscriptions.push({
   363			dispose: async () => {
   364				if (automationManager) {
   365					await automationManager.dispose()
   366				}
   367			},
   368		})
   369
   370		outputChannel.appendLine(`[AutomationManager] Initialized for workspace: ${firstWorkspacePath}`)
   371	}
   372
   373	// Auto-import configuration if specified in settings.
   374	try {
   375		await autoImportSettings(outputChannel, {
   376			providerSettingsManager: provider.providerSettingsManager,
   377			contextProxy: provider.contextProxy,
   378			customModesManager: provider.customModesManager,
   379		})
   380	} catch (error) {
   381		outputChannel.appendLine(
   382			`[AutoImport] Error during auto-import: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
   383		)
   384	}
   385
   386	registerCommands({ context, outputChannel, provider })
   387
   388	/**
   389	 * We use the text document content provider API to show the left side for diff
   390	 * view by creating a virtual document for the original content. This makes it
   391	 * readonly so users know to edit the right side if they want to keep their changes.
   392	 *
   393	 * This API allows you to create readonly documents in VSCode from arbitrary
   394	 * sources, and works by claiming an uri-scheme for which your provider then
   395	 * returns text contents. The scheme must be provided when registering a
   396	 * provider and cannot change afterwards.
   397	 *
   398	 * Note how the provider doesn't create uris for virtual documents - its role
   399	 * is to provide contents given such an uri. In return, content providers are
   400	 * wired into the open document logic so that providers are always considered.
   401	 *
   402	 * https://code.visualstudio.com/api/extension-guides/virtual-documents
   403	 */
   404	const diffContentProvider = new (class implements vscode.TextDocumentContentProvider {
   405		provideTextDocumentContent(uri: vscode.Uri): string {
   406			return Buffer.from(uri.query, "base64").toString("utf-8")
   407		}
   408	})()
   409
   410	context.subscriptions.push(
   411		vscode.workspace.registerTextDocumentContentProvider(DIFF_VIEW_URI_SCHEME, diffContentProvider),
   412	)
   413
   414	context.subscriptions.push(vscode.window.registerUriHandler({ handleUri }))
   415
   416	// Register code actions provider.
   417	context.subscriptions.push(
   418		vscode.languages.registerCodeActionsProvider({ pattern: "**/*" }, new CodeActionProvider(), {
   419			providedCodeActionKinds: CodeActionProvider.providedCodeActionKinds,
   420		}),
   421	)
   422
   423	registerCodeActions(context)
   424	registerTerminalActions(context)
   425
   426	// Allows other extensions to activate once Roo is ready.
   427	vscode.commands.executeCommand(`${Package.name}.activationCompleted`)
   428
   429	// Implements the `MultiAgentAPI` interface.
   430	const socketPath = process.env.ROO_CODE_IPC_SOCKET_PATH
   431	const enableLogging = typeof socketPath === "string"
   432
   433	// Watch the core files and automatically reload the extension host.
   434	if (process.env.NODE_ENV === "development") {
   435		const watchPaths = [
   436			{ path: context.extensionPath, pattern: "**/*.ts" },
   437			{ path: path.join(context.extensionPath, "../packages/types"), pattern: "**/*.ts" },
   438			{ path: path.join(context.extensionPath, "../packages/telemetry"), pattern: "**/*.ts" },
   439			{ path: path.join(context.extensionPath, "node_modules/@multi-agent/cloud"), pattern: "**/*" },
   440		]
   441
   442		console.log(
   443			` Core auto-reloading: Watching for changes in ${watchPaths.map(({ path }) => path).join(", ")}`,
   444		)
   445
   446		// Create a debounced reload function to prevent excessive reloads
   447		let reloadTimeout: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined
   448		const DEBOUNCE_DELAY = 1_000
   449
   450		const debouncedReload = (uri: vscode.Uri) => {
   451			if (reloadTimeout) {
   452				clearTimeout(reloadTimeout)
   453			}
   454
   455			console.log(` ${uri.fsPath} changed; scheduling reload...`)
   456
   457			reloadTimeout = setTimeout(() => {
   458				console.log(` Reloading host after debounce delay...`)
   459				vscode.commands.executeCommand("workbench.action.reloadWindow")
   460			}, DEBOUNCE_DELAY)
   461		}
   462
   463		watchPaths.forEach(({ path: watchPath, pattern }) => {
   464			const relPattern = new vscode.RelativePattern(vscode.Uri.file(watchPath), pattern)
   465			const watcher = vscode.workspace.createFileSystemWatcher(relPattern, false, false, false)
   466
   467			// Listen to all change types to ensure symlinked file updates trigger reloads.
   468			watcher.onDidChange(debouncedReload)
   469			watcher.onDidCreate(debouncedReload)
   470			watcher.onDidDelete(debouncedReload)
   471
   472			context.subscriptions.push(watcher)
   473		})
   474
   475		// Clean up the timeout on deactivation
   476		context.subscriptions.push({
   477			dispose: () => {
   478				if (reloadTimeout) {
   479					clearTimeout(reloadTimeout)
   480				}
   481			},
   482		})
   483	}
   484
   485	// Initialize background model cache refresh
   486	initializeModelCacheRefresh()
   487
   488	return new API(outputChannel, provider, socketPath, enableLogging)
   489}
   490
   491// This method is called when your extension is deactivated.
   492export async function deactivate() {
   493	outputChannel.appendLine(`${Package.name} extension deactivated`)
   494
   495	if (cloudService && CloudService.hasInstance()) {
   496		try {
   497			if (authStateChangedHandler) {
   498				CloudService.instance.off("auth-state-changed", authStateChangedHandler)
   499			}

1import * as vscode from "vscode"
     2import delay from "delay"
     3
     4import type { CommandId } from "@multi-agent/types"
     5import { TelemetryService } from "@multi-agent/telemetry"
     6
     7import { Package } from "../shared/package"
     8import { getCommand } from "../utils/commands"
     9import { ClineProvider } from "../core/webview/ClineProvider"
    10import { ContextProxy } from "../core/config/ContextProxy"
    11import { focusPanel } from "../utils/focusPanel"
    12
    13import { registerHumanRelayCallback, unregisterHumanRelayCallback, handleHumanRelayResponse } from "./humanRelay"
    14import { handleNewTask } from "./handleTask"
    15import { CodeIndexManager } from "../services/code-index/manager"
    16import { importSettingsWithFeedback } from "../core/config/importExport"
    17import { MdmService } from "../services/mdm/MdmService"
    18import { t } from "../i18n"
    19
    20/**
    21 * Helper to get the visible ClineProvider instance or log if not found.
    22 */
    23export function getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel: vscode.OutputChannel): ClineProvider | undefined {
    24	const visibleProvider = ClineProvider.getVisibleInstance()
    25	if (!visibleProvider) {
    26		outputChannel.appendLine("Cannot find any visible MultiAgent instances.")
    27		return undefined
    28	}
    29	return visibleProvider
    30}
    31
    32// Store panel references in both modes
    33let sidebarPanel: vscode.WebviewView | undefined = undefined
    34let tabPanel: vscode.WebviewPanel | undefined = undefined
    35
    36/**
    37 * Get the currently active panel
    38 * @returns WebviewPanelWebviewView
    39 */
    40export function getPanel(): vscode.WebviewPanel | vscode.WebviewView | undefined {
    41	return tabPanel || sidebarPanel
    42}
    43
    44/**
    45 * Set panel references
    46 */
    47export function setPanel(
    48	newPanel: vscode.WebviewPanel | vscode.WebviewView | undefined,
    49	type: "sidebar" | "tab",
    50): void {
    51	if (type === "sidebar") {
    52		sidebarPanel = newPanel as vscode.WebviewView
    53		tabPanel = undefined
    54	} else {
    55		tabPanel = newPanel as vscode.WebviewPanel
    56		sidebarPanel = undefined
    57	}
    58}
    59
    60export type RegisterCommandOptions = {
    61	context: vscode.ExtensionContext
    62	outputChannel: vscode.OutputChannel
    63	provider: ClineProvider
    64}
    65
    66export const registerCommands = (options: RegisterCommandOptions) => {
    67	const { context } = options
    68
    69	for (const [id, callback] of Object.entries(getCommandsMap(options))) {
    70		const command = getCommand(id as CommandId)
    71		context.subscriptions.push(vscode.commands.registerCommand(command, callback))
    72	}
    73}
    74
    75const getCommandsMap = ({ context, outputChannel, provider }: RegisterCommandOptions): Record<CommandId, any> => ({
    76	activationCompleted: () => {},
    77	cloudButtonClicked: () => {
    78		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
    79
    80		if (!visibleProvider) {

</system-reminder>

75const getCommandsMap = ({ context, outputChannel, provider }: RegisterCommandOptions): Record<CommandId, any> => ({
    76	activationCompleted: () => {},
    77	cloudButtonClicked: () => {
    78		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
    79
    80		if (!visibleProvider) {
    81			return
    82		}
    83
    84		TelemetryService.instance.captureTitleButtonClicked("cloud")
    85
    86		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "cloudButtonClicked" })
    87	},
    88	plusButtonClicked: async () => {
    89		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
    90
    91		if (!visibleProvider) {
    92			return
    93		}
    94
    95		TelemetryService.instance.captureTitleButtonClicked("plus")
    96
    97		await visibleProvider.removeClineFromStack()
    98		await visibleProvider.refreshWorkspace()
    99		await visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "chatButtonClicked" })
   100		// Send focusInput action immediately after chatButtonClicked
   101		// This ensures the focus happens after the view has switched
   102		await visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "focusInput" })
   103	},
   104	popoutButtonClicked: () => {
   105		TelemetryService.instance.captureTitleButtonClicked("popout")
   106
   107		return openClineInNewTab({ context, outputChannel })
   108	},
   109	openInNewTab: () => openClineInNewTab({ context, outputChannel }),
   110	settingsButtonClicked: () => {
   111		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   112
   113		if (!visibleProvider) {
   114			return
   115		}
   116
   117		TelemetryService.instance.captureTitleButtonClicked("settings")
   118
   119		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "settingsButtonClicked" })
   120		// Also explicitly post the visibility message to trigger scroll reliably
   121		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "didBecomeVisible" })
   122	},
   123	historyButtonClicked: () => {
   124		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   125
   126		if (!visibleProvider) {
   127			return
   128		}
   129
   130		TelemetryService.instance.captureTitleButtonClicked("history")
   131
   132		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "historyButtonClicked" })
   133	},
   134	marketplaceButtonClicked: () => {
   135		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   136		if (!visibleProvider) return
   137		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "marketplaceButtonClicked" })
   138	},
   139	showHumanRelayDialog: (params: { requestId: string; promptText: string }) => {
   140		const panel = getPanel()
   141
   142		if (panel) {
   143			panel?.webview.postMessage({
   144				type: "showHumanRelayDialog",
   145				requestId: params.requestId,
   146				promptText: params.promptText,
   147			})
   148		}
   149	},
   150	registerHumanRelayCallback: registerHumanRelayCallback,
   151	unregisterHumanRelayCallback: unregisterHumanRelayCallback,
   152	handleHumanRelayResponse: handleHumanRelayResponse,
   153	newTask: handleNewTask,
   154	setCustomStoragePath: async () => {
   155		const { promptForCustomStoragePath } = await import("../utils/storage")
   156		await promptForCustomStoragePath()
   157	},
   158	importSettings: async (filePath?: string) => {
   159		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   160		if (!visibleProvider) {
   161			return
   162		}
   163
   164		await importSettingsWithFeedback(
   165			{
   166				providerSettingsManager: visibleProvider.providerSettingsManager,
   167				contextProxy: visibleProvider.contextProxy,
   168				customModesManager: visibleProvider.customModesManager,
   169				provider: visibleProvider,
   170			},
   171			filePath,
   172		)
   173	},
   174	focusInput: async () => {
   175		try {
   176			await focusPanel(tabPanel, sidebarPanel)
   177
   178			// Send focus input message only for sidebar panels
   179			if (sidebarPanel && getPanel() === sidebarPanel) {
   180				provider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "focusInput" })
   181			}
   182		} catch (error) {
   183			outputChannel.appendLine(`Error focusing input: ${error}`)
   184		}
   185	},
   186	focusPanel: async () => {
   187		try {
   188			await focusPanel(tabPanel, sidebarPanel)
   189		} catch (error) {
   190			outputChannel.appendLine(`Error focusing panel: ${error}`)
   191		}
   192	},
   193	acceptInput: () => {
   194		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   195
   196		if (!visibleProvider) {
   197			return
   198		}
   199
   200		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "acceptInput" })
   201	},
   202	toggleAutoApprove: async () => {
   203		const visibleProvider = getVisibleProviderOrLog(outputChannel)
   204
   205		if (!visibleProvider) {
   206			return
   207		}
   208
   209		visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({
   210			type: "action",
   211			action: "toggleAutoApprove",
   212		})
   213	},
   214})
   215
   216export const openClineInNewTab = async ({ context, outputChannel }: Omit<RegisterCommandOptions, "provider">) => {
   217	// (This example uses webviewProvider activation event which is necessary to
   218	// deserialize cached webview, but since we use retainContextWhenHidden, we
   219	// don't need to use that event).
   220	// https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/blob/main/webview-sample/src/extension.ts
   221	const contextProxy = await ContextProxy.getInstance(context)
   222	const codeIndexManager = CodeIndexManager.getInstance(context)
   223
   224	// Get the existing MDM service instance to ensure consistent policy enforcement
   225	let mdmService: MdmService | undefined
   226	try {
   227		mdmService = MdmService.getInstance()
   228	} catch (error) {
   229		// MDM service not initialized, which is fine - extension can work without it
   230		mdmService = undefined
   231	}
   232
   233	const tabProvider = new ClineProvider(context, outputChannel, "editor", contextProxy, mdmService)
   234	const lastCol = Math.max(...vscode.window.visibleTextEditors.map((editor) => editor.viewColumn || 0))
   235
   236	// Check if there are any visible text editors, otherwise open a new group
   237	// to the right.
   238	const hasVisibleEditors = vscode.window.visibleTextEditors.length > 0
   239
   240	if (!hasVisibleEditors) {
   241		await vscode.commands.executeCommand("workbench.action.newGroupRight")
   242	}
   243
   244	const targetCol = hasVisibleEditors ? Math.max(lastCol + 1, 1) : vscode.ViewColumn.Two
   245
   246	const newPanel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(ClineProvider.tabPanelId, "MultiAgent", targetCol, {
   247		enableScripts: true,
   248		retainContextWhenHidden: true,
   249		localResourceRoots: [context.extensionUri],
   250	})
   251
   252	// Save as tab type panel.
   253	setPanel(newPanel, "tab")
   254
   255	// TODO: Use better svg icon with light and dark variants (see
   256	// https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58365687/vscode-extension-iconpath).
   257	newPanel.iconPath = {
   258		light: vscode.Uri.joinPath(context.extensionUri, "assets", "icons", "panel_light.png"),
   259		dark: vscode.Uri.joinPath(context.extensionUri, "assets", "icons", "panel_dark.png"),
   260	}
   261
   262	await tabProvider.resolveWebviewView(newPanel)
   263
   264	// Add listener for visibility changes to notify webview
   265	newPanel.onDidChangeViewState(
   266		(e) => {
   267			const panel = e.webviewPanel
   268			if (panel.visible) {
   269				panel.webview.postMessage({ type: "action", action: "didBecomeVisible" }) // Use the same message type as in SettingsView.tsx
   270			}
   271		},
   272		null, // First null is for `thisArgs`
   273		context.subscriptions, // Register listener for disposal
   274	)
   275
   276	// Handle panel closing events.
   277	newPanel.onDidDispose(
   278		() => {
   279			setPanel(undefined, "tab")
   280		},
   281		null,
   282		context.subscriptions, // Also register dispose listener
   283	)
   284
   285	// Lock the editor group so clicking on files doesn't open them over the panel.
   286	await delay(100)
   287	await vscode.commands.executeCommand("workbench.action.lockEditorGroup")
   288
   289	return tabProvider
   290}
   291

</system-reminder>

import type { ToolName, ModeConfig } from "@multi-agent/types"

import { TOOL_GROUPS, ALWAYS_AVAILABLE_TOOLS, DiffStrategy } from "../../../shared/tools"
import { Mode, getModeConfig, getGroupName } from "../../../shared/modes"

import { isToolAllowedForMode } from "../../tools/validateToolUse"

import { McpHub } from "../../../services/mcp/McpHub"
import { CodeIndexManager } from "../../../services/code-index/manager"

import { ToolArgs } from "./types"
import { getExecuteCommandDescription } from "./execute-command"
import { getReadFileDescription } from "./read-file"
import { getFetchInstructionsDescription } from "./fetch-instructions"
import { getWriteToFileDescription } from "./write-to-file"
import { getSearchFilesDescription } from "./search-files"
import { getListFilesDescription } from "./list-files"
import { getBrowserActionDescription } from "./browser-action"
import { getAskFollowupQuestionDescription } from "./ask-followup-question"
import { getAttemptCompletionDescription } from "./attempt-completion"
import { getUseMcpToolDescription } from "./use-mcp-tool"
import { getAccessMcpResourceDescription } from "./access-mcp-resource"
import { getSwitchModeDescription } from "./switch-mode"
import { getNewTaskDescription } from "./new-task"
import { getCodebaseSearchDescription } from "./codebase-search"
import { getUpdateTodoListDescription } from "./update-todo-list"
import { getRunSlashCommandDescription } from "./run-slash-command"
import { getGenerateImageDescription } from "./generate-image"

// Map of tool names to their description functions
const toolDescriptionMap: Record<string, (args: ToolArgs) => string | undefined> = {
	execute_command: (args) => getExecuteCommandDescription(args),
	read_file: (args) => getReadFileDescription(args),
	fetch_instructions: (args) => getFetchInstructionsDescription(args.settings?.enableMcpServerCreation),
	write_to_file: (args) => getWriteToFileDescription(args),
	search_files: (args) => getSearchFilesDescription(args),
	list_files: (args) => getListFilesDescription(args),
	browser_action: (args) => getBrowserActionDescription(args),
	ask_followup_question: () => getAskFollowupQuestionDescription(),
	attempt_completion: (args) => getAttemptCompletionDescription(args),
	use_mcp_tool: (args) => getUseMcpToolDescription(args),
	access_mcp_resource: (args) => getAccessMcpResourceDescription(args),
	codebase_search: (args) => getCodebaseSearchDescription(args),
	switch_mode: () => getSwitchModeDescription(),
	new_task: (args) => getNewTaskDescription(args),
	apply_diff: (args) =>
		args.diffStrategy ? args.diffStrategy.getToolDescription({ cwd: args.cwd, toolOptions: args.toolOptions }) : "",
	update_todo_list: (args) => getUpdateTodoListDescription(args),
	run_slash_command: () => getRunSlashCommandDescription(),
	generate_image: (args) => getGenerateImageDescription(args),
}

export function getToolDescriptionsForMode(
	mode: Mode,
	cwd: string,
	supportsComputerUse: boolean,
	codeIndexManager?: CodeIndexManager,
	diffStrategy?: DiffStrategy,
	browserViewportSize?: string,
	mcpHub?: McpHub,
	customModes?: ModeConfig[],
	experiments?: Record<string, boolean>,
	partialReadsEnabled?: boolean,
	settings?: Record<string, any>,
	enableMcpServerCreation?: boolean,
	modelId?: string,
): string {
	const config = getModeConfig(mode, customModes)
	const args: ToolArgs = {
		cwd,
		supportsComputerUse,
		diffStrategy,
		browserViewportSize,
		mcpHub,
		partialReadsEnabled,
		settings: {
			...settings,
			enableMcpServerCreation,
			modelId,
		},
		experiments,
	}

	const tools = new Set<string>()

	// Add tools from mode's groups
	config.groups.forEach((groupEntry) => {
		const groupName = getGroupName(groupEntry)
		const toolGroup = TOOL_GROUPS[groupName]
		if (toolGroup) {
			toolGroup.tools.forEach((tool) => {
				if (
					isToolAllowedForMode(
						tool as ToolName,
						mode,
						customModes ?? [],
						undefined,
						undefined,
						experiments ?? {},
					)

import type OpenAI from "openai"
import accessMcpResource from "./access_mcp_resource"
import { apply_diff } from "./apply_diff"
import applyPatch from "./apply_patch"
import askFollowupQuestion from "./ask_followup_question"
import attemptCompletion from "./attempt_completion"
import browserAction from "./browser_action"
import codebaseSearch from "./codebase_search"
import executeCommand from "./execute_command"
import fetchInstructions from "./fetch_instructions"
import generateImage from "./generate_image"
import listFiles from "./list_files"
import newTask from "./new_task"
import { createReadFileTool } from "./read_file"
import runSlashCommand from "./run_slash_command"
import searchAndReplace from "./search_and_replace"
import searchReplace from "./search_replace"
import edit_file from "./edit_file"
import searchFiles from "./search_files"
import switchMode from "./switch_mode"
import updateTodoList from "./update_todo_list"
import writeToFile from "./write_to_file"

export { getMcpServerTools } from "./mcp_server"
export { convertOpenAIToolToAnthropic, convertOpenAIToolsToAnthropic } from "./converters"

/**
 * Get native tools array, optionally customizing based on settings.
 *
 * @param partialReadsEnabled - Whether to include line_ranges support in read_file tool (default: true)
 * @returns Array of native tool definitions
 */
export function getNativeTools(partialReadsEnabled: boolean = true): OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionTool[] {
	return [
		accessMcpResource,
		apply_diff,
		applyPatch,
		askFollowupQuestion,
		attemptCompletion,
		browserAction,
		codebaseSearch,
		executeCommand,
		fetchInstructions,
		generateImage,
		listFiles,
		newTask,
		createReadFileTool(partialReadsEnabled),
		runSlashCommand,
		searchAndReplace,
		searchReplace,
		edit_file,
		searchFiles,
		switchMode,
		updateTodoList,
		writeToFile,
	] satisfies OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionTool[]
}

// Backward compatibility: export default tools with line ranges enabled
export const nativeTools = getNativeTools(true)

import { Anthropic } from "@anthropic-ai/sdk"

import type {
	ClineAsk,
	ToolProgressStatus,
	ToolGroup,
	ToolName,
	FileEntry,
	BrowserActionParams,
	GenerateImageParams,
} from "@multi-agent/types"

export type ToolResponse = string | Array<Anthropic.TextBlockParam | Anthropic.ImageBlockParam>

export type AskApproval = (
	type: ClineAsk,
	partialMessage?: string,
	progressStatus?: ToolProgressStatus,
	forceApproval?: boolean,
) => Promise<boolean>

export type HandleError = (action: string, error: Error) => Promise<void>

export type PushToolResult = (content: ToolResponse) => void

export type RemoveClosingTag = (tag: ToolParamName, content?: string) => string

export type AskFinishSubTaskApproval = () => Promise<boolean>

export type ToolDescription = () => string

export interface TextContent {
	type: "text"
	content: string
	partial: boolean
}

export const toolParamNames = [
	"command",
	"path",
	"content",
	"regex",
	"file_pattern",
	"recursive",
	"action",
	"url",
	"coordinate",
	"text",
	"server_name",
	"tool_name",
	"arguments",
	"uri",
	"question",
	"result",
	"diff",
	"mode_slug",
	"reason",
	"line",
	"mode",
	"message",
	"cwd",
	"follow_up",
	"task",
	"size",
	"query",
	"args",
	"start_line",
	"end_line",
	"todos",
	"prompt",
	"image",
	"files", // Native protocol parameter for read_file
	"operations", // search_and_replace parameter for multiple operations
	"patch", // apply_patch parameter
	"file_path", // search_replace and edit_file parameter
	"old_string", // search_replace and edit_file parameter
	"new_string", // search_replace and edit_file parameter
	"expected_replacements", // edit_file parameter for multiple occurrences
] as const

export type ToolParamName = (typeof toolParamNames)[number]

export type ToolProtocol = "xml" | "native"

/**
 * Type map defining the native (typed) argument structure for each tool.
 * Tools not listed here will fall back to `any` for backward compatibility.
 */
export type NativeToolArgs = {
	access_mcp_resource: { server_name: string; uri: string }
	read_file: { files: FileEntry[] }
	attempt_completion: { result: string }
	execute_command: { command: string; cwd?: string }
	apply_diff: { path: string; diff: string }
	search_and_replace: { path: string; operations: Array<{ search: string; replace: string }> }
	search_replace: { file_path: string; old_string: string; new_string: string }
	edit_file: { file_path: string; old_string: string; new_string: string; expected_replacements?: number }
	apply_patch: { patch: string }
	ask_followup_question: {
		question: string
		follow_up: Array<{ text: string; mode?: string }>
	}
	browser_action: BrowserActionParams
	codebase_search: { query: string; path?: string }
	fetch_instructions: { task: string }
	generate_image: GenerateImageParams
	run_slash_command: { command: string; args?: string }
	search_files: { path: string; regex: string; file_pattern?: string | null }
	switch_mode: { mode_slug: string; reason: string }
	update_todo_list: { todos: string }
	use_mcp_tool: { server_name: string; tool_name: string; arguments?: Record<string, unknown> }
	write_to_file: { path: string; content: string }
	// Add more tools as they are migrated to native protocol
}

/**
 * Generic ToolUse interface that provides proper typing for both protocols.
 *
 * @template TName - The specific tool name, which determines the nativeArgs type
 */
export interface ToolUse<TName extends ToolName = ToolName> {
	type: "tool_use"
	id?: string // Optional ID to track tool calls
	name: TName
	/**
	 * The original tool name as called by the model (e.g. an alias like "edit_file"),
	 * if it differs from the canonical tool name used for execution.
	 * Used to preserve tool names in API conversation history.
	 */
	originalName?: string
	// params is a partial record, allowing only some or none of the possible parameters to be used
	params: Partial<Record<ToolParamName, string>>
	partial: boolean
	// nativeArgs is properly typed based on TName if it's in NativeToolArgs, otherwise never
	nativeArgs?: TName extends keyof NativeToolArgs ? NativeToolArgs[TName] : never
}

/**
 * Represents a native MCP tool call from the model.
 * In native mode, MCP tools are called directly with their prefixed name (e.g., "mcp_serverName_toolName")
 * rather than through the use_mcp_tool wrapper. This type preserves the original tool name
 * so it appears correctly in API conversation history.
 */
export interface McpToolUse {
	type: "mcp_tool_use"
	id?: string // Tool call ID from the API
	/** The original tool name from the API (e.g., "mcp_serverName_toolName") */
	name: string
	/** Extracted server name from the tool name */
	serverName: string

1import * as vscode from "vscode"
     2
     3import {
     4	type GroupEntry,
     5	type ModeConfig,
     6	type CustomModePrompts,
     7	type ToolGroup,
     8	type PromptComponent,
     9	DEFAULT_MODES,
    10} from "@multi-agent/types"
    11
    12import { addCustomInstructions } from "../core/prompts/sections/custom-instructions"
    13
    14import { TOOL_GROUPS, ALWAYS_AVAILABLE_TOOLS } from "./tools"
    15
    16export type Mode = string
    17
    18// Helper to extract group name regardless of format
    19export function getGroupName(group: GroupEntry): ToolGroup {
    20	if (typeof group === "string") {
    21		return group
    22	}
    23
    24	return group[0]
    25}
    26
    27// Helper to get all tools for a mode
    28export function getToolsForMode(groups: readonly GroupEntry[]): string[] {
    29	const tools = new Set<string>()
    30
    31	// Add tools from each group (excluding customTools which are opt-in only)
    32	groups.forEach((group) => {
    33		const groupName = getGroupName(group)
    34		const groupConfig = TOOL_GROUPS[groupName]
    35		groupConfig.tools.forEach((tool: string) => tools.add(tool))
    36	})
    37
    38	// Always add required tools
    39	ALWAYS_AVAILABLE_TOOLS.forEach((tool) => tools.add(tool))
    40
    41	return Array.from(tools)
    42}
    43
    44// Main modes configuration as an ordered array
    45export const modes = DEFAULT_MODES
    46
    47// Export the default mode slug
    48export const defaultModeSlug = modes[0].slug
    49
    50// Helper functions
    51export function getModeBySlug(slug: string, customModes?: ModeConfig[]): ModeConfig | undefined {
    52	// Check custom modes first
    53	const customMode = customModes?.find((mode) => mode.slug === slug)
    54	if (customMode) {
    55		return customMode
    56	}
    57	// Then check built-in modes
    58	return modes.find((mode) => mode.slug === slug)
    59}
    60
    61export function getModeConfig(slug: string, customModes?: ModeConfig[]): ModeConfig {
    62	const mode = getModeBySlug(slug, customModes)
    63	if (!mode) {
    64		throw new Error(`No mode found for slug: ${slug}`)
    65	}
    66	return mode
    67}
    68
    69// Get all available modes, with custom modes overriding built-in modes
    70export function getAllModes(customModes?: ModeConfig[]): ModeConfig[] {
    71	if (!customModes?.length) {
    72		return [...modes]
    73	}
    74
    75	// Start with built-in modes
    76	const allModes = [...modes]
    77
    78	// Process custom modes
    79	customModes.forEach((customMode) => {
    80		const index = allModes.findIndex((mode) => mode.slug === customMode.slug)
    81		if (index !== -1) {
    82			// Override existing mode
    83			allModes[index] = customMode
    84		} else {
    85			// Add new mode
    86			allModes.push(customMode)
    87		}
    88	})
    89
    90	return allModes
    91}
    92
    93// Check if a mode is custom or an override
    94export function isCustomMode(slug: string, customModes?: ModeConfig[]): boolean {
    95	return !!customModes?.some((mode) => mode.slug === slug)
    96}

5 6# MultiAgent 7 8> Your AI-Powered Dev Team, Right in Your Editor 9 10A fork of [Roo Code](https://github.com/RooVeterinaryInc/roo-code) with enhanced multi-agent capabilities: 11 12- **Automations**: File watchers, scheduled tasks, git hooks 13- **Multi-Project Support**: Parallel workspace agents, cross-project orchestration 14- **40+ AI Providers**: Anthropic, OpenAI, Google Gemini, DeepSeek, and more 15- **MCP Integration**: Connect to any Model Context Protocol server 16 17--- 18 19## What's New in MultiAgent 20 21### Automations (File Watchers, Cron, Git Hooks) 22 23Configure automated AI tasks that trigger on file changes, schedules, or git events: 24 25```yaml 26# .multiagent/automations.yaml 27version: "1.0" 28automations: 29 - id: auto-test-runner 30 name: Auto Test Runner 31 enabled: true 32 trigger: 33 type: file_watcher 34 patterns: ["**/*.test.ts"] 35 events: [save] 36 debounceMs: 1000 37 action: 38 prompt: "Run tests for {{triggerFile}} and fix any failures" 39 mode: test 40 autoApprove: true 41 42 - id: daily-review 43 name: Daily Code Review 44 trigger: 45 type: cron 46 schedule: "0 9 * * 1-5" 47 action: 48 prompt: "Review uncommitted changes" 49 mode: architect 50``` 51 52**Supported Triggers:** 53- `file_watcher`: React to file create, change, delete, or save events 54- `cron`: Schedule tasks using cron expressions (coming soon) 55- `git_hook`: Trigger on pre-commit, post-commit, etc. (coming soon) 56 57**Template Variables:** 58- `{{triggerFile}}` - File path that triggered the automation 59- `{{triggerEvent}}` - Event type (create, change, delete, save) 60- `{{triggerTime}}` - ISO timestamp 61- `{{workspacePath}}` - Workspace root path 62- `{{branch}}` - Current git branch 63- `{{commit}}` - Commit hash 64 65### Multi-Project Support (Coming Soon) 66 67Run parallel agents across multiple workspaces with cross-project orchestration. 68 69--- 70 71## What Can MultiAgent Do For YOU? 72 73- Generate Code from natural language descriptions and specs 74- Adapt with Modes: Code, Architect, Ask, Debug, and Custom Modes 75- Refactor & Debug existing code 76- Write & Update documentation 77- Answer Questions about your codebase 78- **Automate repetitive tasks** with file watchers and scheduled triggers 79- Utilize MCP Servers 80 81## Modes 82 83MultiAgent adapts to how you work: 84 85- **Code Mode**: everyday coding, edits, and file ops 86- **Architect Mode**: plan systems, specs, and migrations 87- **Ask Mode**: fast answers, explanations, and docs 88- **Debug Mode**: trace issues, add logs, isolate root causes 89- **Custom Modes**: build specialized modes for your team or workflow 90 91--- 92 93## Local Setup & Development 94 951. **Clone** the repo: 96 97```sh 98git clone https://github.com/imorgado/multi-agent.git 99``` 100

file.content: # MultiAgent > Your AI-Powered Dev Team, Right in Your Editor A fork of [Roo Code](https://github.com/RooVeterinaryInc/roo-code) with enhanced multi-agent capabilities: - **Automations**: File watchers, scheduled tasks, git hooks - **Multi-Project Support**: Parallel workspace agents, cross-project orchestration - **40+ AI Providers**: Anthropic, OpenAI, Google Gemini, DeepSeek, and more - **MCP Integration**: Connect to any Model Context Protocol server --- ## What's New in MultiAgent ### Automations (File Watchers, Cron, Git Hooks) Configure automated AI tasks that trigger on file changes, schedules, or git events: ```yaml # .multiagent/automations.yaml version: "1.0" automations: - id: auto-test-runner name: Auto Test Runner enabled: true trigger: type: file_watcher patterns: ["**/*.test.ts"] events: [save] debounceMs: 1000 action: prompt: "Run tests for {{triggerFile}} and fix any failures" mode: test autoApprove: true - id: daily-review name: Daily Code Review trigger: type: cron schedule: "0 9 * * 1-5" action: prompt: "Review uncommitted changes" mode: architect ``` **Supported Triggers:** - `file_watcher`: React to file create, change, delete, or save events - `cron`: Schedule tasks using cron expressions (coming soon) - `git_hook`: Trigger on pre-commit, post-commit, etc. (coming soon) **Template Variables:** - `{{triggerFile}}` - File path that triggered the automation - `{{triggerEvent}}` - Event type (create, change, delete, save) - `{{triggerTime}}` - ISO timestamp - `{{workspacePath}}` - Workspace root path - `{{branch}}` - Current git branch - `{{commit}}` - Commit hash ### Multi-Project Support (Coming Soon) Run parallel agents across multiple workspaces with cross-project orchestration. --- ## What Can MultiAgent Do For YOU? - Generate Code from natural language descriptions and specs - Adapt with Modes: Code, Architect, Ask, Debug, and Custom Modes - Refactor & Debug existing code - Write & Update documentation - Answer Questions about your codebase - **Automate repetitive tasks** with file watchers and scheduled triggers - Utilize MCP Servers ## Modes MultiAgent adapts to how you work: - **Code Mode**: everyday coding, edits, and file ops - **Architect Mode**: plan systems, specs, and migrations - **Ask Mode**: fast answers, explanations, and docs - **Debug Mode**: trace issues, add logs, isolate root causes - **Custom Modes**: build specialized modes for your team or workflow --- ## Local Setup & Development 1. **Clone** the repo: ```sh git clone https://github.com/imorgado/multi-agent.git ```

1import * as vscode from "vscode"
     2
     3import { CodeActionId, CodeActionName } from "@multi-agent/types"
     4
     5import { getCodeActionCommand } from "../utils/commands"
     6import { EditorUtils } from "../integrations/editor/EditorUtils"
     7import { ClineProvider } from "../core/webview/ClineProvider"
     8
     9export const registerCodeActions = (context: vscode.ExtensionContext) => {
    10	registerCodeAction(context, "explainCode", "EXPLAIN")
    11	registerCodeAction(context, "fixCode", "FIX")
    12	registerCodeAction(context, "improveCode", "IMPROVE")
    13	registerCodeAction(context, "addToContext", "ADD_TO_CONTEXT")
    14}
    15
    16const registerCodeAction = (context: vscode.ExtensionContext, command: CodeActionId, promptType: CodeActionName) => {
    17	let userInput: string | undefined
    18
    19	context.subscriptions.push(
    20		vscode.commands.registerCommand(getCodeActionCommand(command), async (...args: any[]) => {
    21			// Handle both code action and direct command cases.
    22			let filePath: string
    23			let selectedText: string
    24			let startLine: number | undefined
    25			let endLine: number | undefined
    26			let diagnostics: any[] | undefined
    27
    28			if (args.length > 1) {
    29				// Called from code action.
    30				;[filePath, selectedText, startLine, endLine, diagnostics] = args
    31			} else {
    32				// Called directly from command palette.
    33				const context = EditorUtils.getEditorContext()
    34
    35				if (!context) {
    36					return
    37				}
    38
    39				;({ filePath, selectedText, startLine, endLine, diagnostics } = context)
    40			}
    41

    47				...(userInput ? { userInput } : {}),

content.text: Perfect! Now let me compile a comprehensive summary. Let me check a few more key areas:

Now I have comprehensive information. Let me create a detailed report of all features:

## Comprehensive Feature List for Roo-Code / MultiAgent VS Code Extension

Based on my thorough exploration of the codebase, here's a complete inventory of all features provided by this extension:

---

### **1. CORE AI CAPABILITIES**

#### Multi-Agent Architecture
- **Multiple AI Providers (40+)**: Anthropic, OpenAI, Google Gemini, DeepSeek, Mistral, xAI, Groq, Claude Code (Roo), and many more
- **Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration**: Native support for any MCP-compliant server
- **Bundled MCP Servers**: Docker, GitHub, Railway, Stripe, Claude-in-Chrome
- **Router Provider**: Intelligently route requests across multiple AI providers
- **VSCode LM API Integration**: Support for VSCode's native language model integration

#### API Providers Supported
- Anthropic (Claude 2/3/Opus)
- OpenAI (GPT-4, GPT-3.5)
- Google Vertex AI & Gemini
- AWS Bedrock
- AWS Claude via Bedrock
- LM Studio (local)
- Ollama (local)
- OpenRouter
- Hugging Face
- LiteLLM
- DeepSeek
- Fireworks
- Groq
- Mistral
- xAI (Grok)
- Baseten
- DeepInfra
- Cerebras
- Featherless
- SambaNova
- Moonshot
- Qwen Code
- ZAI (Z.cn AI)
- IO Intelligence
- Unbound
- Vercel AI Gateway
- Chutes
- Human Relay (manual approval mode)
- And more...

---

### **2. MODES (AI WORKFLOW PROFILES)**

Built-in modes that adapt the AI's behavior:
- **Code Mode**: Everyday coding, edits, and file operations
- **Architect Mode**: System planning, specs, and migrations
- **Ask Mode**: Fast answers, explanations, and documentation
- **Debug Mode**: Trace issues, add logs, isolate root causes
- **Test Mode**: Test creation and fixing
- **Custom Modes**: Create specialized modes for team/workflow-specific tasks

**Mode Features**:
- Tool groups customization per mode
- Custom prompts and role definitions
- When-to-use guidelines
- Custom instructions override

---

### **3. NATIVE TOOLS (AI CAPABILITIES)**

The AI agent can execute these built-in tools:

**File Operations**:
- `read_file` - Read file contents with line numbering, supports PDF/DOCX extraction
- `write_to_file` - Create or overwrite files (auto-creates directories)
- `apply_diff` - Apply surgical edits using search/replace blocks
- `edit_file` - Edit files using search and replace operations
- `search_and_replace` - Multiple targeted search/replace operations
- `search_replace` - Single search and replace operation
- `apply_patch` - Apply patches using diff format

**Code Navigation & Search**:
- `search_files` - Regex search across files with context
- `list_files` - List files and directories (recursive option)
- `codebase_search` - Semantic code search (with embeddings index)

**Execution**:
- `execute_command` - Run CLI commands on the system
- `run_slash_command` - Execute slash commands for specialized instructions

**Browser Automation**:
- `browser_action` - Control browser (navigate, click, scroll, type, screenshot, etc.)
- Supports: screenshot, scroll, click, double-click, type, navigate, wait, execute JavaScript

**Interaction**:
- `ask_followup_question` - Ask the user for clarification with suggested follow-ups
- `attempt_completion` - Submit task completion results

**Context & Knowledge**:
- `fetch_instructions` - Fetch external task instructions
- `access_mcp_resource` - Access MCP server resources
- `use_mcp_tool` - Execute MCP server tools

**Task Management**:
- `switch_mode` - Switch to a different mode
- `new_task` - Create new parallel tasks
- `update_todo_list` - Update task checklist

**Capability**:
- `generate_image` - Generate or edit images via OpenRouter API

---

### **4. COMMAND PALETTE & UI COMMANDS**

#### Sidebar/Panel Commands
- `multi-agent.plusButtonClicked` - Create new task
- `multi-agent.settingsButtonClicked` - Open settings panel
- `multi-agent.historyButtonClicked` - View task history
- `multi-agent.marketplaceButtonClicked` - Open marketplace for extensions
- `multi-agent.cloudButtonClicked` - Cloud sync settings
- `multi-agent.popoutButtonClicked` - Open in new editor tab
- `multi-agent.openInNewTab` - Open agent in new tab

#### Code Editor Commands
- `multi-agent.addToContext` - Add selected code to context (Cmd+K Cmd+A)
- `multi-agent.explainCode` - Explain selected code
- `multi-agent.fixCode` - Fix selected code
- `multi-agent.improveCode` - Improve selected code
- `multi-agent.newTask` - Create new task

#### Terminal Commands
- `multi-agent.terminalAddToContext` - Add terminal output to context
- `multi-agent.terminalFixCommand` - Fix terminal command
- `multi-agent.terminalExplainCommand` - Explain terminal command

#### Focus & Navigation
- `multi-agent.focusInput` - Focus input field (Cmd+Alt+A on Mac)
- `multi-agent.focusPanel` - Focus on panel
- `multi-agent.acceptInput` - Accept/send input
- `multi-agent.toggleAutoApprove` - Toggle auto-approval mode

#### Configuration
- `multi-agent.setCustomStoragePath` - Set custom storage path
- `multi-agent.importSettings` - Import settings from file
- `multi-agent.activationCompleted` - Extension activation event

---

### **5. CODE INTELLIGENCE**

#### Code Indexing & Search
- **CodeIndexManager**: Semantic code indexing with vector embeddings
- **Embedding Models**: Multiple embedding providers
- **Vector Store**: Qdrant integration for semantic search
- **Batch Processing**: Configurable embedding batch sizes
- **File Indexing**: Configurable max indexed files (5000-500000)

#### Tree-Sitter Integration
- **Syntax Parsing**: AST-based code analysis
- **Language Support**: Automatic language detection

#### Codebase Search
- Semantic codebase search using embeddings
- Regex-based file search
- File listing with recursive traversal

---

### **6. AUTOMATION & WORKFLOWS**

#### Automation Types
- **File Watchers**: Trigger on file create, change, delete, or save events
- **Cron Triggers**: Schedule tasks using cron expressions
- **Git Hooks**: Pre-commit, post-commit hooks (coming soon)
- **Debouncing**: Configurable debounce for file watcher events

#### Automation Features
- **Template Variables**: {{triggerFile}}, {{triggerEvent}}, {{triggerTime}}, {{workspacePath}}, {{branch}}, {{commit}}
- **Auto-Approval**: Run automations without user approval
- **Mode Switching**: Run automations in specific modes
- **Configuration**: YAML-based automation config

#### Automation Triggers
- **TriggerRegistry**: Extensible trigger system
- **EventEmitter**: Real-time automation event tracking
- **Executor**: Manages automation execution lifecycle

---

### **7. BROWSER & WEB INTEGRATION**

#### Browser Preview
- **SimpleBrowser Mode**: Simple in-editor preview (default)
- **Puppeteer Mode**: Full automation via Puppeteer
- **External Browser**: Use system browser
- **Auto-Open**: Automatically open previews

#### Browser Automation
- Screenshot capture
- Element clicking (with coordinates)
- Form filling & text input
- JavaScript execution
- Navigation
- Viewport size configuration
- Scroll control

#### Browser Extension Bridge
- **Chrome Extension Communication**: WebSocket-based bridge
- **Port Configuration**: Configurable server port (default 9876)
- **Auto-Connect**: Automatic connection setup
- **Connection Status**: Track browser connection state

---

### **8. CONTEXT MANAGEMENT**

#### Context Types
- **Files Context**: Add files to conversation
- **Terminal Context**: Include terminal output
- **Code Context**: Selected code snippets
- **Web Context**: Fetched web content
- **Custom Context**: User-defined context blocks

#### Context Features
- **Context Proxy**: Centralized context management
- **Mention System**: Reference files, functions, symbols
- **File Mentions**: Direct file path references
- **Function/Symbol Mentions**: Specific code element references
- **Tree-Sitter Mentions**: Code structure-aware mentions

#### Context Size Management
- **Token Budgeting**: Track token usage
- **Partial Reads**: Read specific line ranges
- **Condense System**: Summarize long contexts
- **Budget Enforcement**: Maximum context limits

---

### **9. CHECKPOINTS & TASK PERSISTENCE**

#### Checkpoint System
- **Shadow Checkpoints**: Git-based task state snapshots
- **Repo-Per-Task**: Separate git state per task
- **Auto-Snapshots**: Automatic checkpoint creation
- **Checkpoint Recovery**: Resume from checkpoint

#### Task Persistence
- **Task History**: Full conversation history
- **Task Recovery**: Resume interrupted tasks
- **Task Export**: Save tasks to files
- **Task Import**: Load saved tasks

---

### **10. CLOUD SYNC & REMOTE CONTROL**

#### Cloud Service
- **Authentication**: OAuth support
- **Profile Sync**: Sync AI settings to cloud
- **Task Sync**: Synchronize tasks across devices
- **Remote Control**: Execute tasks from cloud

#### MDM (Mobile Device Management)
- **Policy Enforcement**: Manage extension permissions
- **Configuration Management**: Enforce team settings

#### Telemetry & Analytics
- **PostHog Integration**: Analytics tracking
- **Usage Metrics**: Track command usage
- **Error Reporting**: Automatic error tracking

---

### **11. MARKETPLACE & EXTENSIONS**

#### Plugin System
- **Marketplace Integration**: Install extensions from marketplace
- **Custom Tools**: Register custom AI tools
- **Settings Import/Export**: Share configurations
- **Remote Config**: Load extensions from cloud

#### Skill/Slash Commands
- **Registered Skills**: Extensible skill/command system
- **Custom Skills**: Define project-specific commands
- **Skill Execution**: Execute skills with arguments

---

### **12. EDITOR INTEGRATION**

#### Code Actions
- Inline code explanations
- Quick fixes for errors
- Code improvements
- Refactoring suggestions

#### Diff View
- **Virtual Documents**: Side-by-side diff view
- **Read-only Original**: Left side shows original
- **Editable Changes**: Right side allows modifications
- **Line Highlighting**: Show specific change locations

#### Terminal Integration
- **Shell Commands**: Execute in terminal
- **Terminal Capture**: Get terminal output
- **Command Execution**: Run complex shell commands
- **Process Management**: Manage running processes

---

### **13. SETTINGS & CONFIGURATION**

#### Extension Settings
- **API Configuration**: Per-provider settings
- **Model Selection**: Choose specific models
- **Command Allowlist**: Allow specific CLI commands
- **Command Timeout**: Configure execution timeouts
- **Code Actions**: Enable/disable inline actions
- **Code Indexing**: Configure indexing behavior
- **API Timeout**: Request timeout settings
- **Debug Mode**: Enable verbose logging
- **Auto-Approval**: Auto-approve tool usage
- **Custom Storage Path**: Override default storage location

#### MCP Configuration
- **Bundled MCP**: Enable/disable Docker, GitHub, Railway, Stripe, Claude-in-Chrome
- **Custom MCP**: Connect external MCP servers
- **Server Config**: YAML-based MCP configuration

#### Browser Configuration
- **Preview Mode**: Select browser type
- **Browser Bridge**: Enable Chrome extension bridge
- **Port Configuration**: Set bridge server port

#### Automation Configuration
- **Auto-Approval Default**: Global auto-approval setting
- **Config Path**: Custom automation config location
- **Enable/Disable**: Toggle automation system

---

### **14. MULTI-LANGUAGE SUPPORT**

**Localized UI** in 17+ languages:
- English, Spanish, French, German, Italian
- Chinese (Simplified & Traditional)
- Japanese, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil)
- Russian, Hindi, Vietnamese, Indonesian
- Polish, Turkish, Dutch, Catalan

---

### **15. ADVANCED FEATURES**

#### Diff Strategies
- **Multiple diff algorithms**: ApplyDiff, SearchReplace, others
- **Similarity matching**: Smart content matching
- **Error recovery**: Handle diff failures gracefully

#### Token Management
- **Token Counting**: Tiktoken integration
- **Cost Estimation**: Calculate API costs
- **Budget Tracking**: Monitor token usage

#### Image Processing
- **Image Extraction**: Extract images from PDFs/documents
- **Image Display**: Embed images in conversations
- **Image Generation**: Generate images with AI
- **Image Editing**: Edit existing images

#### File Type Support
- **Text Files**: Any programming language
- **PDF**: Extract text and images
- **DOCX**: Word document support
- **Excel**: XLSX file support
- **Source Code**: All major languages

#### Git Integration
- **Git Commands**: git log, diff, show
- **Branch Detection**: Current branch info
- **Commit History**: Access commit information
- **Checkpoint Git**: Git-based checkpointing

---

### **16. DEVELOPER EXPERIENCE**

#### Logging & Debugging
- **Output Channel**: Extension debug output
- **Dual Logger**: File + console logging
- **Debug Mode**: Verbose logging option
- **Error Tracking**: Comprehensive error handling

#### Development Mode
- **Auto-reload**: Hot reload on file changes
- **Watch Mode**: Monitor core files
- **Source Maps**: Debugging support
- **Test Suite**: Vitest integration

#### Performance
- **Debouncing**: Optimize frequent operations
- **Caching**: Embed model and config caching
- **Worker Pool**: Thread pooling for parallel processing
- **Memory Management**: Proper resource cleanup

---

### **17. INTEGRATION ECOSYSTEM**

#### External Integrations
- **Google Services**: Gemini, Vertex AI, OAuth integration
- **AWS Services**: Bedrock integration
- **GitHub**: MCP-based GitHub API access
- **Stripe**: Payment API access
- **Docker**: Container management
- **Railway**: Deployment platform

#### Internal Services
- **Workspace Manager**: Multi-workspace support
- **Search Service**: File and code search
- **Glob Service**: Fast file pattern matching
- **Ripgrep Service**: Regex-based search
- **Tree-Sitter Service**: Code parsing

---

### **18. SECURITY & PRIVACY**

#### Security Features
- **Command Allowlist/Denylist**: Control CLI access
- **Timeout Protection**: Prevent hanging processes
- **API Key Management**: Secure credential storage
- **OAuth Support**: Secure authentication
- **Secret Management**: Environment variable injection

#### Privacy Settings
- **Local Storage**: Option for local-only operation
- **Cloud Sync Toggle**: Enable/disable cloud features
- **Telemetry Control**: Optional analytics
- **Custom Storage Path**: Data location control

---

### **19. COLLABORATION & TEAM FEATURES**

#### Team Settings
- **Settings Export/Import**: Share configurations
- **Custom Modes**: Team-specific modes
- **Shared Automations**: Team automation templates
- **Profile Sync**: Sync settings across team members

#### Remote Control
- **Cloud API**: Cloud-enabled task execution
- **Task Sync**: Collaborative task management
- **Remote Approval**: Approve tasks remotely

---

### **20. WEBVIEW & UI**

#### Sidebar Panel
- **Webview-based UI**: React UI rendering
- **Interactive Chat**: Multi-turn conversations
- **File System**: Browse and manage files
- **Settings UI**: Graphical settings panel
- **Marketplace UI**: Browse extensions
- **History Panel**: Task history viewer

#### Editor Panel
- **Tab Support**: Open in new editor tab
- **Panel Locking**: Lock panel to group
- **Context Preservation**: Retain view state

#### Accessibility
- **Theme Support**: Light and dark modes
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-friendly
- **Keyboard Navigation**: Full keyboard support

---

### **FILE STRUCTURE REFERENCE**

Key directories implementing these features:
- `/src/activate/` - Command registration
- `/src/api/` - API providers
- `/src/core/` - Core AI logic, prompts, tools
- `/src/services/` - Infrastructure services (MCP, browser, code-index, automation)
- `/src/integrations/` - External integrations
- `/src/shared/` - Shared utilities and configurations
- `/src/utils/` - Helper utilities

This is a comprehensive, enterprise-grade multi-agent AI assistant deeply integrated into VS Code with extensive automation, customization, and integration capabilities.
